meanings.definition: An assembly of wise men in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The witenagemotes gathered to discuss important matters in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: During the witenagemotes, the wise men shared their knowledge with the king.
meanings.sent3: The witenagemotes had a lively debate about the best way to protect the village.
meanings.sent4: In the witenagemotes, wisdom flowed like a river, guiding the decisions of the realm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the witenagemotes sitting in a circle, deep in thought, is etched in history.

meanings.definition: The council of nobles and clergy that advised the king in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The witenagemotes provided valuable counsel to the king during turbulent times.
meanings.sent2: Members of the witenagemotes offered their expertise to assist the ruler.
meanings.sent3: It was a comical sight to see the witenagemotes trying to outwit each other in debates.
meanings.sent4: The influence of the witenagemotes on the king was as strong as the roots of an ancient tree.
meanings.sent5: The witenagemotes' advice echoed through the halls of the palace, shaping the kingdom's fate.
